item.title: Git Shit: Origins
item.description: On April 3rd, 2005, Linus Torvalds released a Linux kernel release candidate, 2.6.12-rc2. While the release candidate itself was relatively unremarkable, consisting of just a few bug fixes, it became significant for what it represented: the last Linux kernel release before the adoption of Git. Stone Age: Linus as a Version Control Service Link to heading Initially, Linus-as-a-version-control-service, aka Linus himself, was the preferred version control tool for the Linux kernel.
